newsitem.title: UK: World 96/97 coffee output up at 99 mln bags--Licht.
newsitem.headline: World 96/97 coffee output up at 99 mln bags--Licht.

text.p: forecast to rise to a revised 99 million bags in 1996/97 (previously 97.7 million) from 87.88 million in 1995/96, German statistician F.O. Licht said on Tuesday.

Exports could reach 77.78 million bags from 73.35 million in 1995/96 while global consumption (including the 25 million bags consumed in producing countries) could total 99.5 million, Licht said in its latest estimate of the world coffee balance.

Licht said the revised production estimate reflected higher robusta output. The estimate for robusta coffee has been raised by 1.2 million bags to 33.47 million from its previous forecast while the figure for arabicas has been reduced by 42,000 bags.
It kept its Brazilian 1996/97 crop estimate unchanged at 28.5 million bags. It gave no forecast for the Colombian crop except saying that it would be below 1995/96's 12.9 million.

Licht said coffee consumption in importing countries could be about 1.3 million bags lower in calendar 1997 compared with those in 1996 due to the adverse impact of the high bean prices earlier this year.
Stocks in importing nations were currently at 20-year lows. Producer stocks were also at the lowest level in many years.
"Consequently, there is little headway in case there should be a production shortfall in 1997/98," Licht said. -- Jalil Hamid, London newsroom +44 171 542 4985
